meanings.definition: To avoid work or duty by staying away or leaving early.
meanings.sent1: Tom skived off school by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: She always skived on Fridays to go to the beach.
meanings.sent3: The cat skived off its responsibilities by napping all day.
meanings.sent4: The student skived through the semester without studying.
meanings.sent5: The employee skived off work by sneaking out early.

meanings.definition: To cut off a thin slice from the edge of a piece of leather or other material.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman skived the leather to make it thinner.
meanings.sent2: She skived a piece of wood to fit it into the frame.
meanings.sent3: The chef skived a slice of cheese for the sandwich.
meanings.sent4: He skived the paper to create a precise edge.
meanings.sent5: The tailor skived the fabric to reduce its thickness.
